biokit 0.1.1
  • Reference

Default automatic biokit analysis

autoBiokitAnalysis.Rd

This wrapper function performs the "default" analyses of the package.

autoBiokitAnalysis(
  mat,
  sampInfo,
  groupCol,
  funCatList,
  statMode,
  annotationMode,
  filterByExpr,
  splitUpDown = TRUE,
  splitCol = "logFc",
  splitMidPoint = 0,
  sigCutoff = 0.05,
  metricCutoff = 1,
  rankCol = "logFc",
  topN = 50,
  decreasing = TRUE,
  absolute = TRUE,
  minFunCatSize = 1,
  maxFunCatSize = Inf,
  gseaRankCol = "logFc",
  gseaNPerm = 10000
)

Arguments

mat

The input matrix containing normalized data or counts
sampInfo

The sample information data frame.
groupCol

The column containing the grouping variable
funCatList

A list of character vectors with the functional categories to analyze.
statMode

Type of statistical analysis to perform the row-wise comparison. Allowed values are: "edgeR", "limma" "tTest", which will apply autoEdgerComparison, autoLimmaComparison and autoPairwiseMatrixTest, respectively.
annotationMode

Approach to annotate differential features. Allowed values are: "byCutoff or "byRank", which will apply addStatusByCutoff or addStatusByRank.
filterByExpr

If "edgeR" is selected, use filterByExpr?
splitUpDown

Split annotation into up and down features? If TRUE, splitCol and splitMidPoint should be provided.
splitCol

If splitUpDown is set to TRUE, the column used to split features into up and down.
splitMidPoint

If splitUpDown is set to TRUE, the splitCol value considered as midpoint.
sigCutoff

If annotation mode is "byCutoff", the adjusted p value cutoff to use.
metricCutoff

If annotation mode is "byCutoff", the absolute log FC cutoff to use.
rankCol

If annotation mode is "byRank", the column used to rank results.
topN

If annotation mode is "byRank", the top N features to annotate.
decreasing

If annotation mode is "byRank", order rankCol decreasing?
absolute

If annotation mode is "byRank", use absolute rankCol values?
minFunCatSize

Minimal size of a functional category to test. All functional categories below the threshold are excluded.
maxFunCatSize

Minimal size of a functional category to test. All functional categories aboce the threshold are excluded.
gseaRankCol

Column used to create pre-ranked gsea list.
gseaNPerm

Number of permutations to perform in the pre-ranked gsea analysis.

Value

A list containing three data frames: Statistical results, over-representation analysis results and gene set enrichment analysis results.
